abstract: First-quarter profit fell 5.8 percent at General Electric, which is seen as one of the most reliable earners. The Dow Jones industrial average lost more than 250 points.
snippet: First-quarter profit fell 5.8 percent at General Electric, which is seen as one of the most reliable earners. The Dow Jones industrial average lost more than 250 points.
lead_paragraph: The first week of earnings reports ended Friday with a thud.

headline.main: Market Drops After a Week of Bad News
headline.print_headline: In Rare Miss, G.E. Profit Falls Short

abstract: Wall Street firms and banks aren’t the only ones getting slammed by the recent market turmoil. General Electric on Friday reported a surprise 6 percent drop in profit, saying that market disruptions led to higher-than-expected losses at its finance businesses. It also lowered its earnings forecast for the year.
lead_paragraph: Wall Street firms and banks aren’t the only ones getting slammed by the recent market turmoil. General Electric on Friday reported a surprise 6 percent drop in profit, saying that market disruptions led to higher-than-expected losses at its finance businesses. It also lowered its earnings forecast for the year.

abstract: CNBC interviews Jeff Immelt, General Electric's chief executive, on the company's rare earnings miss.
